definition: to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: All voting systems are open to tampering and error.
sentences.chinese: 所有的投票系統都能被人做手腳或出錯。

sentences.english: But parents complained the software could have been rigged.
sentences.chinese: 但家長抗議說軟件是可以做手腳的。

sentences.english: Chloe also said you intentionally scrambled the voice to slow down her process.
sentences.chinese: 克羅伊還說你故意在聲音上做手腳以便能拖住她。
